dohGuide.title: How to Enable DNS over HTTPS (DoH) in Chrome
dohGuide.intro: Follow these steps to enable secure DNS (DoH) in your Chrome browser:
dohGuide.step2: 2. Search for 'security' in the settings search bar.
dohGuide.step3: 3. Scroll down to the 'Advanced' section and find 'Use secure DNS'.
dohGuide.step4: 4. Enable 'Use secure DNS' and select 'With custom provider'.
dohGuide.step5: 5. Enter your preferred DoH provider URL (e.g., https://dns.google/dns-query).
dohGuide.done: You have successfully enabled DNS over HTTPS!

dohPoll.q1: Did you know you can change Chrome's DNS for more privacy?
dohPoll.q2: Would you like to see a step-by-step DoH activation guide?
dohPoll.notifyBody: Enabling DNS over HTTPS increases your privacy and security. Click for more info.
steps: Go to Chrome Security Settings.
In the Advanced section, find Use secure DNS.

In Custom provider, enter one of the following URLs:
https://dns.google/dns-query
https://cloudflare-dns.com/dns-query
dohPoll.note: This only changes DNS for Chrome, not your whole system.
